summary:
Style your web pages with colors, fonts, and layouts. Learn selectors, properties, box model, colors, typography, and the cascade. This lesson provides comprehensive coverage of the topic with practical examples and hands-on activities. Students will gain a deep understanding through interactive learning materials and real-world applications. The lesson includes detailed explanations, visual aids, and assessment tools to ensure mastery of the concepts.

This topic provides essential knowledge for understanding webdev at the Junior level. Through comprehensive study, students will develop a deep understanding of the concepts, principles, and applications related to CSS Basics. The material is designed to build a strong foundation for further learning and practical application in real-world contexts. This topic provides comprehensive coverage essential for understanding webdev at the beginner level. Through detailed study, students will gain deep insights into the concepts, principles, and real-world applications. The material is designed to build a strong foundation for further learning and practical application in various contexts.
why_it_matters: This programming/technology topic provides practical skills highly sought after in the job market and enables you to build real-world applications and solve technical problems.

assignments.title: Research Assignment: CSS Basics

tasks: Read the assigned textbook chapters and online resources about CSS Basics
Identify and explain at least three key concepts from the topic
Find one real-world example or application of these concepts
Write a 300-500 word summary explaining your findings
Include at least two credible sources in your research

assignments.title: Practical Exercise: CSS Basics
assignments.description: Apply your understanding of CSS Basics through hands-on activities.
tasks: Complete the lab exercises or simulations related to CSS Basics
Document your observations and findings in a lab report
Answer the reflection questions about what you learned
Create a visual representation (diagram, chart, or model) of key concepts
Present your findings to the class or submit a written report
